text: The Cabreria spiny-chest frog (Alsodes barrioi) is a frog. It lives in Chile. ==Home== People find this frog under logs and stones near streams on mountains. Scientists have seen the frog between 1000 and 1500 meters above sea level. ==Young== This frog's tadpoles swim in streams. ==Danger== Scientists say this frog is in big danger of dying out. Human beings change the place where the frog lives to make pine tree farms and places for cows to eat grass. Human beings also start fires. ==First paper== * ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Alsodes barrioi
